00020 #ifndef BOOST_INCLUDED_XINT_PRIME_HPP
00021 #define BOOST_INCLUDED_XINT_PRIME_HPP

00024 namespace boost {
00025 namespace xint {
00026 namespace detail {
00027 
00028 inline std::vector<int> sieveOfEratosthenes(int upTo) {
00029     std::vector<int> sieve;
00030     sieve.reserve(upTo);
00031 
00032     // Zero and one aren't prime, by definition.
00033     sieve.push_back(0);
00034     sieve.push_back(0);
00035 
00036     for (int p = 2; p < upTo; ++p) sieve.push_back(p);
00037 
00038     std::vector<int> ret;
00039 
00040     int *p = &sieve[0], *e = p + upTo;
00041     while (p < e) {
00042         if (*p == 0) { ++p; continue; }
00043         ret.push_back(*p);
00044 
00045         int *p2 = p + (*p);
00046         while (p2 < e) { *p2 = 0; p2 += *p; }
00047 
00048         ++p;
00049     }
00050 
00051     return ret;
00052 }
00053 
00054 // The Miller-Rabin Probabilistic Test of Primality
00055 BOOST_XINT_RAWINT_TPL
00056 int isProbablePrimeBaseB(const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT n, const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT b,
00057     callback_t callback)
00058 {
00059     const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT one(1), nMinus1(n - one);
00060 
00061     // Find r and a satisfying: n - 1 = 2^a * r, r odd
00062     BOOST_XINT_RAWINT r(nMinus1);
00063     unsigned long a = 0;
00064     while (r.is_even()) { r >>= 1; ++a; }
00065 
00066     // We check the congruence class of b^((2^i)r) % n for each i
00067     // from 0 to a - 1. If any one is correct, then n passes.
00068     // Otherwise, n fails.
00069     BOOST_XINT_RAWINT test = powmod(b, r, n);
00070     if (test == one || test == nMinus1)
00071         return 1; // Better than 3/4 chance it's prime
00072 
00073     while (a-- > 0) {
00074         test = sqrmod(test, n);
00075         if (test == nMinus1) return 1;
00076     }
00077 
00078     if (callback && !callback()) return -1;
00079     return 0;
00080 }
00081 
00082 BOOST_XINT_RAWINT_TPL
00083 int is_prime(const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT n, callback_t callback) {
00084     BOOST_XINT_RAWINT tmp(2);
00085     if (n < tmp) throw exceptions::invalid_argument("xint::is_prime cannot "
00086         "test numbers below 2");
00087 
00088     // First we trial-divide it by the primes below 2000
00089     static const std::vector<int> low_primes(sieveOfEratosthenes(2000));
00090     const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT zero;
00091     std::vector<int>::const_iterator i = low_primes.begin(), ie =
00092         low_primes.end();
00093     for (; i != ie; ++i) {
00094         tmp.set_unsigned(*i);
00095         if ((n % tmp) == zero)
00096             return (n == tmp);
00097     }
00098 
00099     // Ensure that we've got a random generator.
00100     static std::auto_ptr<default_random_generator> gen(new
00101         default_random_generator);
00102     detail::random_generator<default_random_generator> random(*gen.get());
00103 
00104     // Run the number through the Miller-Rabin Probabilistic Test of Primality
00105     // a few times to see if it's actually (probably) prime.
00106     for (int count = 0; count < 5; ++count) {
00107         unsigned int k = random();
00108         tmp.set_unsigned(k);
00109         int isP = isProbablePrimeBaseB(n, tmp, callback);
00110         if (isP <= 0) return isP;
00111     }
00112     return 1; // Appears to be prime!
00113 }
00114 
00115 BOOST_XINT_RAWINT_TPL
00116 template <typename GenType>
00117 BOOST_XINT_RAWINT BOOST_XINT_RAWINT::random_prime(GenType& gen, std::size_t
00118     size_in_bits, callback_t callback)
00119 {
00120     if (size_in_bits < 2) throw exceptions::invalid_argument("cannot create "
00121         "prime numbers smaller than two bits");
00122 
00123     // Call the callback for the first time
00124     if (callback && !callback()) return 0;
00125 
00126     // If, by rare chance, the number we're testing gets larger than the number
00127     // of bits requested, we have to start over with a new random number of the
00128     // proper size.
00129     BOOST_XINT_RAWINT pe;
00130     pow2(pe, size_in_bits + 1);
00131 
00132     const BOOST_XINT_RAWINT two(2);
00133     while (1) {
00134         BOOST_XINT_RAWINT target = random_by_size(gen, size_in_bits, true, true,
00135             false);
00136         while (target < pe) {
00137             int r = is_prime(target, callback);
00138             if (r < 0) return 0;
00139             if (r == 1) return target;
00140             target += two;
00141         }
00142     }
00143 }
